intro.title: Focus on the Present
description: When waves of anxiety hit, the first thing to do is to anchor yourself in the "here and now".
Before letting go of anxiety, you need to pause and take a breath.
Turn off the complex thoughts for a moment and focus only on the sensations your body and surroundings are sending you right now.
This process becomes the strongest foundation for safely letting anxiety pass.
intro.contentDescription: A grounding technique that uses your five senses to anchor your mind.
steps: 3. Focus on 3 sounds you can hear
intro.tip: Tip: Focus slowly on the sensations as they are, without judgment.

step2.subject: 4 Things You Can Touch
step2.example: The firmness of a chair, texture of clothes, etc.

step3.subject: 3 Things You Can Hear
step3.example: Distant noise, ticking of a clock, etc.

step5.subject: 1 Thing You Can Taste
step5.example: The sensation in your mouth or aftertaste of water you just drank

step.hint: * Press the button when you find a sensation

result.title: You've safely anchored yourself
result.description: You've awakened your senses one by one and anchored yourself in the present. Now, instead of confusing thoughts, you can fully focus on the peace of this moment. You're ready. Start practicing discovering your true emotions through the next step, the Emotion Diary.
